programme.title: Last Train to Christmas
programme.desc: Tony Towers, a successful nightclub manager and local celebrity, embarks upon the 3:17 to Nottingham for a Christmas family reunion in 1985, but things soon get a little strange. Moving up a carriage to the buffet car lands him in 1995, where he finds his clubs have failed and his life has fallen apart. Tony discovers that by moving up and down this fateful train, he can transport himself forward and backward to various stages of his life. Not only that, but the actions he takes in one carriage directly affect his life in the next. programme.title: Elvis
programme.sub-title: Romance, Drama, Music, Arts And Culture, Musical, Documentary And Factual ║ 2022 ║ 12A
programme.desc: Gospel-loving singer Elvis Presley witnesses America's bitter racial divisions while continuing to support performers such as BB King and Little Richard. programme.title: Puss In Boots: The Last Wish
programme.sub-title: Action, Comedy, Romance, Drama, Animation, Family, Children's ║ 2022 ║ PG
programme.desc: The swashbuckling cat joins forces with sexy pickpocket Kitty Softpaws and lovable stray dog Perrito to journey deep into the Dark Forest. Director Elizabeth Banks's comedy thriller based on true events, starring Keri Russell, Alden Ehrenreich, O'Shea Jackson Jr and Ray Liotta in one of his final films Elizabeth Banks - Director Keri Russell - Colette Matthews O'Shea Jackson Jr - Howard Alden Ehrenreich - Marty Ray Liotta - Dentwood Isiah Whitlock Jr - Bob Kristofer Hivju - Olaf Margo Martindale - Ranger Liz Jesse Tyler Ferguson - Peter Brooklynn Prince - Dee Dee.

programme.title: Renfield
programme.desc: For more than 100 years, Robert Montague Renfield has been at the beck and call of his manipulative master, Count Dracula. When Renfield seeks refuge at a local church, a man who facilitates meetings for addicts of unhealthy relationships empowers the servant to stand up to his controlling boss. Comedy horror, starring Nicholas Hoult, Nicolas Cage and Awkwafina Chris McKay - Director Nicolas Cage - Dracula Nicholas Hoult - Renfield Awkwafina - Rebecca Quincy Shohreh Aghdashloo - Bella Francesca Lobo Brandon Scott Jones - Mark Ben Schwartz - Teddy Lobo.

programme.title: The Black Phone
programme.desc: In 1970s North Denver, a masked predator nicknamed The Grabber poses as a magician to lure unsuspecting children into the back of his van. Five youngsters vanish without trace despite the best efforts of Detectives Wright and Miller to identify a prime suspect. Their enquiries lead to Gwen Shaw, an abused girl who claims to have prophetic dreams about the missing boys. Horror, starring Mason Thames, Ethan Hawke, Madeleine McGraw and Jeremy Davies Scott Derrickson - Director Ethan Hawke - The Grabber Mason Thames - Finney Shaw Madeleine McGraw - Gwen Shaw Jeremy Davies - Mr Shaw James Ransone - Max.

programme.title: Nope
programme.sub-title: Horror, Thriller, Drama, Sci Fi, Mystery ║ 2022 ║ 15
programme.desc: OJ Haywood and sister Emerald inherit the family's California ranch from their father, who is killed by debris falling from the sky. The siblings are under pressure to sell the property to former child actor Jupe Park, who runs the Jupiter's Claim theme park on neighbouring land with his wife, Amber. When all hope seems lost, the Haywoods discover an unidentified aerial phenomenon hovering over their homestead. Writer-director Jordan Peele's sci-fi thriller, starring Daniel Kaluuya, Keke Palmer and Steven Yeun Jordan Peele - Director Daniel Kaluuya - OJ Haywood Keke Palmer - Emerald Haywood Steven Yeun - Ricky \Jupe\ Park Brandon Perea - Angel Torres Michael Wincott - Antlers Holst Wrenn Schmidt - Amber Park Donna Mills - Bonnie Clayton Eddie Jemison - Buster Keith David - Otis Haywood Sr.

programme.title: Emily
programme.desc: Emily Bronte yearns to win the respect of her father, Irish Anglican priest Patrick Bronte, but his praise is reserved for her sister Charlotte and brother Branwell. She is assigned French lessons with the new parish curate, William Weightman, and an initially combative relationship kindles forbidden desire. Writer/director Frances O'Connor's drama, starring Emma Mackey, Oliver Jackson-Cohen and Adrian Dunbar Frances O'Connor - Director Emma Mackey - Emily Brontë Oliver Jackson-Cohen - William Weightman Fionn Whitehead - Branwell Brontë Alexandra Dowling - Charlotte Brontë Amelia Gething - Anne Brontë Adrian Dunbar - Patrick Brontë Gemma Jones - Aunt Branwell.

programme.title: Mr Malcolm's List
programme.desc: In 19th-century England, London's most eligible bachelor, Jeremy Malcolm, judges potential love matches against a secret list of 10 personality traits and accomplishments, including an education based on extensive reading and a forgiving nature. programme.title: Linoleum
programme.desc: Cameron Edwin has always dreamed of becoming an astronaut, but his career path led him to television instead. When the network announces it will move his failing kid's science programme to a late-night slot, it's clear that his glory days are over. Then a series of extraordinary events lead to Cameron building a rocket in his garage in an attempt to make his dreams come true. Writer/director Colin West's sci-fi comedy drama, starring Jim Gaffigan, Rhea Seehorn and Katelyn Nacon Colin West - Director Jim Gaffigan - Cameron Edwin / Kent Armstrong Rhea Seehorn - Erin Edwin Katelyn Nacon - Nora Edwin Gabriel Rush - Marc Amy Hargreaves - Linda Michael Ian Black - Tony Tony Shalhoub - Dr Alvin.

programme.title: Armageddon Time
programme.desc: Jewish-American 11-year-old Paul Graff attends Public School 173 in 1980 New York, where dreams of NASA and space rockets are a distraction from the teachings of ill-tempered Mr Turkeltaub. Consequently, Paul becomes a target for humiliation in class alongside African-American student Johnny Davis. The boys become friends, but prejudices repeatedly test their bond. programme.title: M3gan
programme.sub-title: Horror, Thriller, Drama, Sci Fi, Comedy ║ 2023 ║ 15
programme.desc: Gemma, a toy company robotics engineer, applies for temporary protective custody of her nine-year-old niece, Cady, after her parents are killed. A hi-tech doll called M3GAN, which has malfunctioned in development, becomes Cady's unusual guardian, but the flaky android soon causes mayhem. programme.title: The Last Rifleman
programme.desc: Artie Crawford is a Second World War veteran who has just lost his wife. programme.desc: 'Magic' Mike Lane is working as a bartender after a business deal goes wrong. By chance, he serves drinks at a party to wealthy socialite Maxandra Mendoza. programme.desc: Artie Crawford is a Second World War veteran who has just lost his wife. programme.title: The Last Rifleman
programme.desc: Artie Crawford is a Second World War veteran who has just lost his wife. On the 75th anniversary of the D-Day landings in Normandy, Artie decides to secretly escape his Northern Ireland care home, and embarks on a journey to France to pay his final respects to his best friend. Drama, starring Pierce Brosnan and Jurgen Prochnow Terry Loane - Director Pierce Brosnan - Artie Crawford Clémence Poésy - Juliette.

programme.title: Renfield
programme.desc: For more than 100 years, Robert Montague Renfield has been at the beck and call of his manipulative master, Count Dracula. When Renfield seeks refuge at a local church, a man who facilitates meetings for addicts of unhealthy relationships empowers the servant to stand up to his controlling boss. programme.desc: Highlights of the Premier League game against Everton.

programme.title: PL: United v Everton 99/00
programme.desc: United Archives 4/12/99. The Intercontinental Cup champions return from Japan to put five goals past Everton, with Ole Gunnar Solskjaer grabbing four of them.

programme.title: PL: Everton v United 98/99
programme.desc: United Archives 31/10/98. Summer signing Jesper Blomqvist pulled the strings for United in this clash at Goodison Park, scoring his first goal for the club in the process.

programme.title: Div 1: Everton v United 88/89
programme.desc: United Archives 30/10/88. United & Everton were both expected to challenge for the league title but after making slow starts of the season, both were desperate for victory at Goodison Park.

programme.desc: Erik ten Hag's press conference ahead of the Premier League game against Everton.

programme.title: 2000 PL Goals: 2016/17
programme.desc: Manchester United are the first club to score 2000 Premier League goals. Relive the 2016/17 season and goals 1803 - 1856.

programme.title: PL: Everton v United 97/98
programme.desc: United Archives 27/8/97. Following a goalless draw with Leicester City the Reds looked to get back to winning ways at Goodison Park.

programme.title: PL: United v Everton 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 3/2/01. Sir Alex went head to head with fellow Scotsman Walter Smith, as the Reds welcomed Everton.

programme.title: Manager's Press Conference
programme.desc: Erik ten Hag's press conference ahead of the Premier League game against Everton.

programme.title: PL: Everton v United 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 16/9/00. After thrashing Anderlecht in midweek, the Reds looked to keep their fine form going at Goodison Park.

programme.desc: The Bryan Robson Story.'.

programme.title: PL: Everton v United 02/03
programme.desc: United Archives 11/5/03. The final game of the season and also David Beckham's United career. United had already won the Championship and could finally lift the trophy at Goodison Park.

programme.title: PL: Everton v United 03/04
programme.desc: United Archives 7/2/04. A cliched game of two halves at Goodison Park, including a 100th United goal for Ruud van Nistelrooy, the second fastest Red to achieve this feat behind the great Denis Law.

programme.sub-title: Live: Manchester City v RB Leipzig ║ Sport ║ S2023E111 ║ Subs
programme.desc: Manchester City v RB Leipzig (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the Group G match from Etihad Stadium, as the current champions look to finish top of the group with victory in this meeting. Two late goals from Julian Alvarez and Jeremy Doku gave City a 3-1 victory in the reverse fixture back in October, as Pep Guardiola's side equalled the record for the longest European unbeaten run by an English club.

Coverage of the Group B match from Emirates Stadium, as Mikel Arteta's side look for the victory that would get them through to the last 16, as well as confirming them as group winners. The reverse fixture saw the French side come from behind to win 2-1, with goals from Adrien Thomasson and Elye Wahi cancelling out Gabriel Jesus' opener.
